meanings.definition: Test or experiment to assess performance or suitability.
meanings.sent1: The trialling of the new software revealed some bugs.
meanings.sent2: The company is conducting a trialling of the new product before its official launch.
meanings.sent3: During the trialling of the chef's new recipe, the kitchen was filled with delicious aromas.
meanings.sent4: The trialling of the athlete's skills on the field proved his dedication to training.
meanings.sent5: The trialling of the safety equipment in extreme conditions showed its durability.

meanings.definition: Participating in a trial or test.
meanings.sent1: She was trialling the new medication to see if it helped with her symptoms.
meanings.sent2: The trialling students were nervous before the exam.
meanings.sent3: The trialling volunteers were excited to be part of the medical study.
meanings.sent4: The trialling athletes were determined to prove their abilities in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The trialling employees were eager to showcase their skills during the assessment.

meanings.definition: The act of putting something to the test.
meanings.sent1: The trialling of the theory involved various experiments in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The trialling of the new car model included crash tests and performance evaluations.
meanings.sent3: The trialling of the robot's capabilities amused the engineers in the workshop.
meanings.sent4: The trialling of the new teaching method resulted in improved student engagement.
meanings.sent5: The trialling of the prototype revealed areas for improvement in the design.
